page.title: 06ECOLOGY , DYKES , FLOODING
page.content:
{
The land is regarded as "heavy agricultural land". Much of the area is clay based and the dyke system is an essential part of the drainage system. Water drains from the dyke system at the Humber when the tide is low. Natural drainage is impossible at high tide which results in flood possibilities. A system of locks is used to control the dyke flow and there are a number of pumping stations at critical points. These are not sufficient at certain times and flooding takes place. Farmers often allow poor sections of land to be flooded to protect crops. Urban areas are rarely flooded.
